alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, southeastern Baker, northwestern Clay, southwestern Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glen St. Mary, or 19 miles north of Raiford, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Cecil Field, Maxville, Bryceville, Baldwin and Whitehouse Air Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
